meanings.definition: In a manner that shows relief or reassurance.
meanings.sent1: She sighed relievedly after finding her lost keys.
meanings.sent2: He smiled relievedly when he heard the good news.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed relievedly after finally catching the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun emerged from behind the clouds, shining relievedly on the rain-soaked earth.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter patted the dog relievedly after rescuing it from the burning building.

meanings.definition: With a feeling of comfort or satisfaction after a worry or problem has been resolved.
meanings.sent1: The child slept relievedly knowing the monster under the bed was just a dream.
meanings.sent2: She ate her favorite meal relievedly after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled relievedly, happy to entertain the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed relievedly in the warm sunlight after a week of rain.
meanings.sent5: The student nodded relievedly as the teacher praised his hard work.
